best.why: It acts as the perfect bookend to Section I, returning to the core economic thesis (cheap slop vs. expensive judgment) without merely repeating it. Unlike B, C, and E, it avoids the defensive posture of asking 'is it art?', instead asserting a confident position 'inside the ruin'â€”a necessary acknowledgement of the ethical complexities raised in Section VII.

worst.why: It creates an immediate, jarring redundancy by repeating the 'Leave the slop on the floor' line, which was already shouted in all-caps in Section V. It brings nothing new to the conclusion.

must_survive_line: The art was never in the tool. It was in the no.
